prs.title: docs: Remove outdated doc 'avoid coercions that throw uncaught errors'
Add Allow arbitrary character length in nanoid

reviews.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 0**
üßπ Nitpick comments (3)
src/__tests__/enum.test.ts (1)
`44-53`: **LGTM! Consider adding more test cases for comprehensive coverage.** The test correctly verifies the type inference for the extended enum. However, to ensure robust functionality, consider adding the following test cases: ```typescript test("extends - edge cases", () => { const BaseEnum = z.enum(["A", "B"]); // Test extending with empty array const EmptyExtended = BaseEnum.extends([]); util.assertEqual, "A" | "B">(true); // Test extending with duplicate values const DuplicateExtended = BaseEnum.extends(["B", "C"]); util.assertEqual, "A" | "B" | "C">(true); // Test runtime behavior expect(DuplicateExtended.options).toEqual(["A", "B", "C"]); expect(() => DuplicateExtended.parse("D")).toThrow(); // Test error mapping const ErrorMappedEnum = BaseEnum.extends(["C"], { errorMap: () => ({ message: "Invalid value!" }) }); const result = ErrorMappedEnum.safeParse("D"); expect(result.success).toBe(false); if (!result.success) { expect(result.error.issues[0].message).toBe("Invalid value!"); } }); ```
src/types.ts (1)
`4410-4418`: **Add JSDoc documentation for the new extends method.** The implementation looks good but is missing documentation to explain its purpose and parameters. Add JSDoc comments like this: ```diff + /** + * Creates a new enum by extending the current enum with additional values. + * @param values - Array of new values to add to the enum + * @param newDef - Optional parameters to customize the new enum definition + * @returns A new ZodEnum instance containing all values + */ extends( values: ToExtend, newDef: RawCreateParams = this._def ): ZodEnum<[...T, ...Writeable]> { ```
README.md (1)
`1170-1170`: **Markdown Styling: Emphasis Markers** There are extra spaces inside the emphasis markers on the `.extends()` header. For a cleaner markdown style (per MD037), consider changing `** `.extends()` **` to `**`.extends()`**`.
üß∞ Tools
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.17.2) 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis) --- 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis)
üìú Review details **Configuration used: CodeRabbit UI** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Pro**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between e30870369d5b8f31ff4d0130d4439fd997deb523 and 65e0427b6f8c9ec198125960f592ae830a38f7f1.
üìí Files selected for processing (3) * `README.md` (1 hunks) * `src/__tests__/enum.test.ts` (1 hunks) * `src/types.ts` (1 hunks)
üß∞ Additional context used
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.17.2)
README.md 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis) --- 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis)
üîá Additional comments (2)
src/types.ts (1) `4410-4418`: **LGTM! The implementation is clean and type-safe.** The implementation correctly extends the enum by: - Using proper type constraints - Efficiently combining arrays - Preserving the original definition - Allowing customization via optional params
README.md (1) `1170-1178`: **Documentation Addition: Introducing the `.extends()` Method** The new documentation clearly explains how to extend an existing enum with additional values. The example: ```ts const SalmonAndTrout = z.enum(["Salmon", "Trout"]); const FishEnum = SalmonAndTrout.extends(["Tuna"]); ``` illustrates how users can create a superset enum. Please double-check that this example aligns precisely with the implementation in the type definitions (e.g., in `src/types.ts`) for consistency.
üß∞ Tools
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.17.2) 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis) --- 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis)

**Actionable comments posted: 0**
üßπ Nitpick comments (3)
src/types.ts (1)
`4410-4418`: **Add documentation for the new `.extend()` method.** The implementation looks good but would benefit from JSDoc documentation explaining the purpose, parameters and return value. Add documentation above the method: ```diff + /** + * Creates a new enum by extending an existing enum with additional values + * @param values - Array of new values to add to the enum + * @param newDef - Optional parameters to override in the new enum + * @returns A new ZodEnum instance containing all values + */ extend( values: ToExtend, newDef: RawCreateParams = this._def ): ZodEnum<[...T, ...Writeable]> { ```
README.md (2)
`1170-1171`: **Formatting Issue: Remove extra spaces in emphasis markers** There are extra spaces inside the emphasis markers in the new heading. To comply with markdown lint MD037 (no-space-in-emphasis), consider changing: ```diff -** `.extend()` ** +**`.extend()`** ```
üß∞ Tools
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.17.2) 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis) --- 1170-1170: Spaces inside emphasis markers null (MD037, no-space-in-emphasis)
--- `1176-1177`: **Documentation Continuity** The transition from the `.extend()` example to the subsequent section on `.exclude/.extract()` is smooth. For clarity, consider adding a brief note that explains when one might use `.extend()` versus `.exclude`/`.extract` so that users can quickly decide the appropriate method for their use case.
üìú Review details **Configuration used: CodeRabbit UI** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Pro**

üîá Additional comments (2)
src/types.ts (1) `4410-4418`: **LGTM! Implementation follows best practices.** The implementation: - Maintains immutability by creating a new instance - Uses const generics for type safety - Preserves original definition parameters - Correctly merges the enum values
README.md (1) `1171-1175`: **New Enum Extension Example** The new example clearly demonstrates how to extend an existing Zod enum using the newly introduced `.extend()` method. The code snippet‚Äîcreating a `SalmonAndTrout` enum and then extending it with `"Tuna"`‚Äîis self-explanatory and aligns with the intended functionality described in the PR objectives.

**Actionable comments posted: 0**
üßπ Nitpick comments (2)
README.md (1)
`539-540`: **Enhance the GQLoom Entry Description** The new entry for GQLoom has been added correctly with the appropriate link and a concise description. To further enhance clarity and better reflect the tool‚Äôs unique value‚Äîas highlighted in the PR objectives‚Äîconsider expanding the description slightly (for example, by emphasizing its "code-first" approach and integration features with popular ORMs). Also, double-check that the punctuation and phrasing are consistent with the other entries in the list.

deno/lib/README.md (1)
`539-539`: **New Ecosystem Entry for GQLoom Added** The new entry for **GQLoom** integrates well into the Ecosystem list, providing a useful resource that showcases how Zod can be extended to generate GraphQL schema and resolvers. Consider reviewing the phrasing for consistency; for example, it might read more naturally as ‚ÄúWeave GraphQL schemas and resolvers using Zod‚Äù (note the plural ‚Äúschemas‚Äù) to align with the common terminology in similar entries. Additionally, please double-check punctuation according to your style guide as a static analysis hint mentioned a loose punctuation mark near this addition.

test: add back no printable characters test since is valid test
